meanings.definition: A way of marching in very close file, with each person's leg moving at the same time as the corresponding leg of the person in front.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers moved in lockstep during the parade.
meanings.sent2: The dancers moved in perfect lockstep during the performance.
meanings.sent3: In the lockstep march, it looked like they were all dancing together.
meanings.sent4: Their lockstep movement resembled a synchronized dance routine.
meanings.sent5: The lockstep of their march was mesmerizing to watch.

meanings.definition: A way of working or moving together in perfect agreement and with no differences.
meanings.sent1: The team worked in lockstep to complete the project on time.
meanings.sent2: The orchestra played in lockstep to create beautiful music.
meanings.sent3: Their lockstep collaboration made the task seem effortless.
meanings.sent4: Their ideas moved forward in lockstep, creating a seamless process.
meanings.sent5: The lockstep of their movements made them a formidable team.
